contextId.information: This refers to God's word, which they believed. AT: "God's word, which you heard and the truth that you believed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: what you have received and heard

contextId.information: It is understood that he is coming in order to judge. AT: "I am coming to judge soon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

John expects his readers to know about them because many years earlier another prophet had written about them. AT: "the two olive trees and the two lampstands that scripture tells about" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]]) )
contextId.quote: the two olive trees and the two lampstands

contextId.information: What God did with his great power can be stated clearly. AT: "you have defeated with your power everyone who has rebelled against you" (UBS) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: you have taken your great power

contextId.information: "people could buy or sell things only if they had the mark of the beast." The implicit information that the beast from the earth commanded it can be stated clearly. AT: "He commanded that people could buy or sell things only if they had the mark of the beast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: It was impossible for anyone to buy or sell unless he had the mark of the beast

contextId.information: How they were victorious over the number can be stated clearly. AT:  "over the number representing his name by not being marked with that number" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: over the number representing his name

contextId.information: The image of the wine in the bowls can be stated clearly. The word "wrath" here refers to punishment. The wine is a symbol for punishment. AT: "seven gold bowls full of the wine that represents God's wrath" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])
contextId.quote: seven golden bowls full of the wrath of God

contextId.information: The image of the wine in the bowls can be stated clearly. The word "wrath" here refers to punishment. The wine is a symbol for punishment. AT: "bowls full of the wine that represents God's wrath." See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:15:07|15:7]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])

It can be stated clearly that the Lord Jesus was saying this as in the UDB. The parentheses are used here to show that this is not part of the storyline in the vision. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here "fear" does not mean to be afraid of God, but to honor him. AT: "all you who honor him" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Here "spirit of prophecy" refers to God's Holy Spirit. AT: "because it is the Spirit of God who gives people the power to speak the truth about Jesus" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: for the testimony about Jesus is the spirit of prophecy

contextId.information: Here "justice" refers to what is right. AT: "He judges all people according to what is right" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: It is with justice that he judges

contextId.information: These are the names that the prophet Ezekiel used to represent faraway countries. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

It is understood that he is coming in order to judge. AT: "I am coming to judge soon!" See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:03:09|3:11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Possible meanings are 1) that this is an invitation for people to come and drink the water of life. AT: "Come and drink!" or 2) that this is a polite request for Jesus to return. AT: "Please come!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
